comments.body: Netherite tools and armor should definitely be buffed, the tools should have some kind of special bonus as well as the armor if you are wearing the full set (besides knockback resistance), to make netherite gear more unique and special from diamond gear.
This would be very cool, and I'd rather have buffed netherite tools and armor while netherite becoming rarer rather than just how it is now. It would be more balanced and a true upgrade.

I suggest that a Netherite Pickaxe, as well as all other tools, have some sort of base efficiency level in addition to the extra durability. Just enough that deep slate becomes instant mine with Haste II and Efficiency V. Like what a Diamond Pickaxe does for stone. Lets give more reason to grind for that Netherite. I also like the Idea for a base fire resistance buff to armor. It all gives a reason to mine the depths of the nether for this rare item.

The new snapshot has added trims and an extra step to making netherite.

Different trims / materials for trims should give the armour different buffs to make the extra grinding worth it.

I support this idea out of sheer love of kites. It could serve as a visual marker hanging in a ceaseless current high up into the clouds...but you need wind mechanics.

How else could a kite be useful? Like if wind blew on it could it pull something?

I think the kites could be tied to animals too, and could serve as a tracker, but small animals could be blown away, a wind mechanic would help in the possibilities. I also thought that they could be of some use with elytras, perhaps for better control. There are many possibilities that kites hold, but I cannot think of all of them alone.
With the kites, i will no longer need to build a tower of blocks to locate my house

I was thinking yesterday about this idea. And I would like to add something. For example: if the right mouse button clicks a hoe on a salb or a stairs, we will receive a slab or stairs from dirt. They will be able to overgrow with grass. I think it would fit into the canons of Minecraft

sorry for English, i'm not a native speaker.

P.S. I want to note a very clear and correct style of writing a sentence. It is rare to find similar
I have a tablet?
Yes! I also wondered why it didn't burn in brazier.
Maybe if you actually put a normal gapple in an enchanting table instead of gold blocks and enchant it with like 5 EXP Lvls (30 required) lmao
this feature will most likely NEVER return due to it being too OP.
I'm always for adding more blocks.
Wow
maybe functional items too like a mining machine or pipes. Maybe a lava forge or conveyor belt, stuff like that
caimans are crocodilians not lizards but both caimans and lizards are reptiles.
nice idea though.
they live in the amazon so jungle would suit them better

What if wearing gold gives you immunity to wither effect by reducing the Effect time depending on armor piece?

Helmet = 20,833%

Chestplate = 33,333%

Leggings = 29,166%

Boots = 16,666%

Effect time reduction.

(Full gold = 100% then)

The crafting recipe for a golden arrow should be similar to a regular arrow but replacing the flint with a gold ingot, or combining a regular arrow with a gold ingot. It should do more damage to all mobs, but the damage bonus should be the greatest for wither mobs like you said!

Stained wood should only be craftable from a stripped log or wood of any tree variety (not from Nether fungus). Eight stripped logs/wood surrounding a dye would yield eight "Stripped DYE COLOR Log" or "Stripped DYE COLOR Wood". Texture would be dyed Oak, regardless of wood variant used, e.g., stained doors and trapdoors would match Oak Doors and Oak Trapdoors in style. All subsequent crafting with the stained logs would replace the word "Oak" with the name of the dye color, e.g., "Magenta Slab". Items such as sticks, ladders, chests, etc., that have no wood specification, would be craftable but would not be stained.
I like this idea because it would be very useful for it to be easier to not have to use commands.
Thank You @CoolHerobrine96. I would like that players will try to practice aim by shooting at a Armour Stand placed in a moving Minecart.

I just googled this after failing to put armour stands in minecarts. It would be a great survival technique in order to give a base some animation without having to rely on mods or datapacks too heavily. I was honestly surprised you couldn't do so already, since armorstands were traditionally built on Mob code.
I really want soda
For such a common resource, this is quite a lot.

It is not quite as good as iron, and made using bones and bone blocks. It is simply an alternative for wooden tools while you search for a tree (like if you spawn in an ice spikes) they are each crafted in your inventory rather than a crafting table.

came across this while googling for a 'how to' on how to place something in the offhand. Surprises me that there isn't a way to put something in in the stand's offhand, already.  I agree totally with the original post. I suppose that was evident by my vote for the feature, but didn't want you to think it was just another offhand remark... Have a great day.

A creative exclusive item that dosent fit Minecraft in the slightest
Just download a mod

There are minecarts and flying machines if you don’t want horses. Also, you can get lots of car mods/add-ons so there is no need to add it to the main game. Also, you can retexture iron horse armour to look like a motorcycle.

My clogged-up Zombified Piglin farm would appreciate this, especially with the Crafter being implemented. Just a simple way to make it more compact would be great. I know the idea of a whole block of this stuff is a little gruesome for Minecraft, so maybe a rename or less gruesome texture would fix that.

That’s a great idea! Such an item definitely sounds like it would already be apart of Minecraft. However, lapis lazuli is the staple for enchanting, and therefore I feel it would make more sense that such an item would gives effects like saturation, fire protection and maybe an effect that acts like thorns on armour for a hundred seconds
Mythic gold is used for armor, trading, and apples.
It should nauseate you for ten seconds just so its not super overpowered.
Ok, Minecraft dungeons has enchanted mobs, right? well maybe we can bring that into regular minecraft so the lapis lazuli apple gives you a random enchantment.

Good idea because I think Lapis doesn't have as many uses as other ores. Enchanting is of course a big thing but you don't need that much Lapis to do it. You quickly reach a point when you just stop mining Lapis because it is only used for enchanting. It can also be used for blue dye but a flower farm is better and faster. A Lapis apple won't completely solve this but it will make everything much better.
Jordan folly, Steve can carry thousands of blocks of gold in a single hand. Also what is the point of netherite as it only increases durability to weapons
It should be real hard to craft, since it sounds a little OP.  Like, some of most of the ingredients should be rare drops from Piglin bartering.
Why should it be?
I would only want it if it turned creatures into their baby variants since hostile mobs would give more xp.
I was just about to post the same idea!
I don't think that you can obtain an excess of nautilus shells in survival Minecraft. Good idea for creative world though.
I have a tonne of shells but only a few heart of the sea. Can we please have a nautilus shell block?

I play survival only and I have 2-3 stacks of nautilus shells from killing drowned. I think it would be cool to have nautilus shell come in multiple colors and 4 shells of the same color could be crafted into a crushed seashell block, which would make a great landscaping or path block. The color should be sandy white with hints / fragments of brown and the color of the nautilus shell.
I have a double chest full of nautilus shells from my drowned farm. Please please add add a Nacre block!
A nautilus shell block would look amazing! I'm surprised this doesn't have more votes

Hi. That's a good idea. I'd add the ability to loot dead nautilus shells directly from ocean biomes using a Silk Touch pickaxe, and for the shell to be a decorative block that can be used as a flower pot. Personally, I think that would be cool. Don't you?

And I completely agree with those who suggest easily craftable crushed shell blocks and nautilus shells.

I'm all for it, anyway. :)
I like the idea, it could use a lapislazuli block.
That would be a berry bush under the noteblock right?  Like ... a berrytone sax!  *tsts*
Yes, this could be added, especially if my suggestion adding bronze gets implemented!
why
Really who is gonna use soap in Minecraft.
That would make my lava bathtub so worthless
uh... why
What happens if a player is too dirty?

If you get too dirty, it could give you a poison effect (because you got sick) or something like that. Also, we could add scents as well (no particular reason; just because irl soap smells disgusting without scents).

I just encountered this and it was very un-intuitive. I was trying to power a furnace minecart with a Lava bucket and couldn't figure out why it didn't work.

I even tried using a hopper to "Deposit" the lava bucket before realizing that the Furnace only takes coal
Target Golem
Perfect for a training camp
Every time the entity is hit, it's mass as viewed by a weighted pressure plate, should increase

This would be really cool and useful. Maybe when you hit it it could also produce a Redstone signal too. Also adding a way to see how much damage you do to it (a damage counter) will also make it really useful for a fighting dummy. It would be nice to also be able to put armor on the target dummy, so you could see how much damage the armor reduces with the damage counter.
It would be interesting if they 'aggro' ranged mob like archer or pillager ( spawning naturally in village to protect villager during raid ) and fly like blaze at 2 or 3 block from the ground.
No, if enchantments become cross compatible on bows, they'll easily be the best weapon in the game by far. As if they weren't good enough already.

I think there should be a use for the fletching table, but dont think it should be this. Perhaps it could be used more similarly to a stonecutter where you obtain more of a crafted resource for the inputs than you would at a crafting bench? And perhaps be the only way to make the potion dipped arrows. Maybe bring back the minecraft quiver, and use this to upgrade it, so I can get these arrows out of my pocket and into a carried inventory that makes more sense...?

This doesn't make sense. A crossbow is not just a bow with extra steps. It's a whole different weapon, created differently. And if the 2 weapons can have the same enchantments, then the game would be broken. Bow are stronger, but crossbow are more precise and can use fireworks. The 2 weapons should stay different
Maybe we could use this block to take apart the bow?
If square variants would also be possible to make like some of the Paper Lanterns from Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind, this is a grand idea.
Would love this, wish the colour of the lantern would reflect the colour of the light given off though.
